msContents.summary: Papyrus list of candidates for public offices, in the Apollonopolites Heptakomias, Egypt. One fragment mentions Antaios son of Hierax from Tanyaithis as the candidate for the post of scribe (of the strategos or highest civil official in the region?); he apparently owns land near Tanyaithis. The other fragment lists a property valuation at 10,100 drachmas and lists Besarion as a candidate for public office. Part of the papers of Apollonios, the well-known strategos of the Apollonopolites Heptakomias. Verso has an account of money taxes in Greek (P.Duk.inv. 512 V)

msItemStruct.note: Dimensions of fragments are 11.8 x 15.5 cm. or smaller
Written along the fibers on the recto; written across the fibers on the verso in a different hand
Left margin of 2 cm on the smaller fragment
P.Duk.inv. 512 R was formerly P.Miss. 78 R and P.Miss. 79 R

Related to another papyrus (P.Giss. 59) that was published in: Kornemann, Ernst and Meyer, Paul. Griechische Papyri im Museum des Oberhessischen Geschichtsvereins zu Giessen. Leipzig and Berlin: B.G. Teubner, 1910-1912

supportDesc.support: 1 item : papyrus, 2 fragments which do not join mounted in 2 glass frames, incomplete

origin.persName: Apollonios, (Strategos of the Apollonopolite Heptakomias Nome, Egypt)

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.
